oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Implementation of a Feedlot Medicine Program
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jim, G. K.
Guichon, D. T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: production medicine program
industry knowledge
program evaluation
action plan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The word implementation is defined as "to put into effect: to carry out." The critical areas which must be considered in the implementation of a successful production medicine program include identification of appropriate clientele, acquisition of extensive industry knowledge, a fundamental change to the veterinary-client relationship, the establishment of a framework for program evaluation, and a well constructed action plan.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 38-39
